Tier 1 Artifact Type.One-line definition (use when the docume: States mandatory rules and intent from leadership; sets binding direction for the organization
Tier 1 Artifact Type.Common altLabels / aliases: Corporate Policy, Information Security Policy, HR Policy

Tier 1 Artifact Type.One-line definition (use when the docume: Defines specific, measurable controls or configurations required to meet a policy
Tier 1 Artifact Type.Common altLabels / aliases: Technical Standard, Configuration Standard, Control Standard, Baseline

Tier 1 Artifact Type.One-line definition (use when the docume: Describes the steps to carry out a recurring process end-to-end (who/what/when)
Provides detailed, step-by-step how-to for a single task or transaction
Tier 1 Artifact Type.Common altLabels / aliases: WI, How-To, Job Aid (detailed), Work Instruction

Tier 1 Artifact Type.One-line definition (use when the docume: Offers recommended (non-mandatory) practices and tips; advisory in nature
Explains long-term goals, principles, scope, and success metrics at portfolio or domain level
Shows time-phased view of initiatives/releases and major milestones
Commits resources and schedule for a defined scope (project/initiative)
Tier 1 Artifact Type.Common altLabels / aliases: Project Plan, Implementation Plan, Transition Plan

Tier 1 Artifact Type.One-line definition (use when the docume: Authorizes a project/program; defines scope, governance, roles, and success criteria
Asks for approval/funding to pursue an initiative or solution with options and benefits
Tier 1 Artifact Type.Common altLabels / aliases: Business Case, Concept Paper, Funding Request

Tier 1 Artifact Type.One-line definition (use when the docume: States specific, verifiable needs the solution must meet
Tier 1 Artifact Type.Common altLabels / aliases: Requirements Specification, User Requirements, System Requirements, URS, SRS

Tier 1 Artifact Type.One-line definition (use when the docume: Documents the technical characteristics, design, or behavior of a solution
Illustrates how a solution is structured and its components interact
Tier 1 Artifact Type.Common altLabels / aliases: Solution Design, High Level Design, Low Level Design

Tier 1 Artifact Type.One-line definition (use when the docume: Models a process in diagrammatic form (e.g., flowchart, swimlane); minimal narrative
Tier 1 Artifact Type.Common altLabels / aliases: Process Flow Diagram, Process Map, Flowchart

Tier 1 Artifact Type.One-line definition (use when the docume: Defines data elements, valid values, formats, and ownership
Presents findings/metrics and narrative analysis for a defined period or topic
Shows near-real-time KPIs and visual summaries with minimal narrative
Summarizes meeting attendees, decisions, actions, and due dates
Records formal decisions with options, rationale, owner, and date
Lists risks with probability/impact, owners, and mitigations
Tracks active issues/defects with status, owner, and resolution actions
Requests an approved change to scope/config/process with impact and approvals
Legally binding terms between parties (commercial or confidentiality)
Defines scope, deliverables, milestones, and pricing for contracted work
Provides steady-state operational procedures (monitoring, jobs, recovery, support)
Tier 1 Artifact Type.Common altLabels / aliases: Operations Guide, Support Runbook, Operations Manual

Tier 1 Ambiguity guardrails.Use when… (primary intent / signals): Mandatory, executive-approved rules with compliance expectation
Tier 1 Ambiguity guardrails.Notes: Policy sets intent; Standard implements it.

Tier 1 Ambiguity guardrails.Use when… (primary intent / signals): Prescriptive control/config to satisfy a policy
Recommended practices; non-binding advice
Multi-step process across roles or systems
Detailed steps for one task/transaction
Long-term goals, principles, and positioning
Concrete commitments—scope, schedule, resources
Tier 1 Ambiguity guardrails.Notes: Plan is the "what" & "when" of a project.

Tier 1 Ambiguity guardrails.Use when… (primary intent / signals): Visual, time-phased view of releases/initiatives
Official authorization for a project/program
Asking for approval/funding; presents a case
Tier 1 Ambiguity guardrails.Notes: Proposal seeks approval; Plan assumes it.

Tier 1 Ambiguity guardrails.Use when… (primary intent / signals): States verifiable needs from a business or system perspective
Detailed definition of characteristics or behavior
Illustrates the structure and solution architecture
Narrative analysis of data/findings over a period
Visual display of KPIs/metrics with minimal narrative
Summary of attendees, actions, and due dates
Formal decisions with options, rationale, owner
Potential events with probability/impact and mitigation
Current problems needing resolution
Legal master terms & obligations
Scope, deliverables, schedule, pricing under a contract
Formal request to alter baseline with impact and approvals
Tier 1 Ambiguity guardrails.Notes: CR may point to the decision ID.

Tier 1 Ambiguity guardrails.Use when… (primary intent / signals): Steady-state IT ops tasks (monitoring, jobs, recovery)

Domain Ambiguity guardrails.Use when… (primary intent / signals): Business goals, scope, success criteria; problem/need statement; not solution detail
Domain Ambiguity guardrails.Notes: BRD may reference future FSD/PDD—primary intent decides.

Domain Ambiguity guardrails.Use when… (primary intent / signals): End-to-end process steps, inputs/outputs, controls; baseline for config & testing
Domain Ambiguity guardrails.Notes: If both narrative and model exist: BPMN = model; PDD = narrative.

Domain Ambiguity guardrails.Use when… (primary intent / signals): What the system must do; rules & acceptance criteria for build
Domain Ambiguity guardrails.Notes: If one file mixes FS/TS, choose dominant intent; add other as keyword.

Domain Ambiguity guardrails.Use when… (primary intent / signals): Behavioral spec at business level; black-box view
Technical internals: objects, tables, APIs, error handling, mappings
Domain Ambiguity guardrails.Notes: If it’s a single WRICEF object, consider WRICEF instead of broad TSD.

Domain Ambiguity guardrails.Use when… (primary intent / signals): Why a configuration choice was made (options, rationale, decision)
What configuration was done (settings, values, IMG path)
Visual process model, usually formal BPMN
Narrative description of process steps/flow
Domain Ambiguity guardrails.Notes: PDD provides prose/context to the process.

Domain Ambiguity guardrails.Use when… (primary intent / signals): Comparison of SAP standard vs business need; gaps noted
Domain Ambiguity guardrails.Notes: FGA may reference a PDD but focuses on gaps.

Domain Ambiguity guardrails.Use when… (primary intent / signals): Detailed process steps as a baseline for config
Domain Ambiguity guardrails.Notes: PDD defines the baseline; FGA notes deviations from it.

Domain Ambiguity guardrails.Use when… (primary intent / signals): High-level test approach, scope, roles, environments
Domain Ambiguity guardrails.Notes: Plan is high-level; case is specific.

Domain Ambiguity guardrails.Use when… (primary intent / signals): Step-by-step instructions for test execution
Domain Ambiguity guardrails.Notes: Test case is the granular how-to.

Domain Ambiguity guardrails.Use when… (primary intent / signals): Behavioral/requirements focus; what the system needs to do
Technical build details; objects, code, mappings
Operations & support procedures (monitoring, jobs, recovery)
Formal decision record with options, rationale, owners, decision ID
Risks/Assumptions/Issues/Dependencies tracking
Meeting summary: attendees, decisions, actions, due dates
Domain Ambiguity guardrails.Notes: MIN may link to DEC/RAID; it isn’t itself a decision or risk log.

Domain Ambiguity guardrails.Use when… (primary intent / signals): Solution/architecture blueprint, patterns, NFRs, integration topology
Request to change scope/config/code with impact, estimate, approvals
Domain Ambiguity guardrails.Notes: CRQ may reference DEC that authorized it.

Domain Ambiguity guardrails.Use when… (primary intent / signals): Role/authorization design (auth objects, catalogs, SoD)
Learning/training content for end-users

Domain Specific Artifact type.One-line definition (use when the docume: states business goals, scope, constraints, and success criteria at a business level
compares current vs target capabilities and records gaps, resolutions, and impacts
defines end-to-end business process steps, inputs/outputs, controls, and owners
models process logic in BPMN (typically Signavio), linked to solutions
explains the why behind key configuration choices and parameters
documents the what/how of SAP configuration (IMG settings, values)
outlines solution architecture, integrations, patterns, and non-functionals
specifies functional behavior the build must meet (rules, UX, acceptance)
specifies build details (objects, code logic, tables, mappings, error handling)
defines interface purpose, endpoints, payloads, frequency, error scenarios
describes data fields and value mappings for a data migration object
sequences cutover activities, timings, dependencies, and checkpoints
provides steady-state operational procedures (monitoring, jobs, recovery)
captures design/ scope decisions with options, rationale, and owners
tracks Risks, Assumptions, Issues, Dependencies with status/actions
summarizes meetings (attendees, decisions, actions, due dates)
enables end-users (job aids, simulations, courses, quick refs)
requests a change with impact, estimate, approvals (often via ChaRM)
defines roles, auth objects, transactions/Fiori catalogs, SoD notes
specifies a single Workflow/Report/Interface/Conversion/Enhancement/Form
details test steps, data, expected results for SIT/Regression
provides business-facing acceptance scenarios and criteria
records a defect, reproduction steps, severity, and resolution
tracks post-load data balancing/reconciliation activities

LifecyclePhase_Rules.If (signals): File date within Discover timeline OR doc title contains "Vision, Business Case"
Build, Configuration, Unit Test, SIT in title/body

Status_Rules.Secondary action: Link to replacement doc if referenced

Region_Rules.If (signals): Company code/plant code patterns tied to region (e.g., US10, MX20)

Confidentiality_Rules.If (signals): PII/PHI markers: "SSN, SIN, passport, PHI, HIPAA"

GenericType_Rules.Secondary action: Set SOW as secondary if both signals fire

Identifier_Extraction.If (signals): Interface code tokens (e.g., IF-###, IDoc types)

ObjectCategory_Rules.If (signals): IDoc OR pattern of basic types (ORDERS05, DESADV, INVOIC02)

ProcessArea_Rules.If (signals): Title/Body contains "O2C" OR "Order to Cash" OR "OTC"

ArtifactType_Rules.If (signals): Title OR Filename contains "Functional Spec" OR "FSD" OR startswith("FS ")
ArtifactType_Rules.Secondary action: Set TSD as secondary if both signals fire

ArtifactType_Rules.If (signals): H1/H2 contains "Functional Specification" OR section "Acceptance Criteria"
Title OR Filename contains "Technical Spec|Technical Design|TSD|TS "
ArtifactType_Rules.Secondary action: Set FSD secondary if FS signals fire

ArtifactType_Rules.If (signals): H1/H2 includes "Technical Specification/Design" OR object tables present (Z\w{3,})
Title contains "UAT Script|User Acceptance Test|Business Acceptance"

ArtifactType_Rules.Secondary action: Link mentions to DEC/RAID via IDs

ArtifactType_Rules.If (signals): Title contains "Security Role Matrix|SoD Matrix|Auth Matrix"
